verses.plain: A slothful man is compared to a filthy stone, and every one will hiss him out to his disgrace.

tokens.t: A slothful man is compared to a filthy stone, and every one will hiss him out to his disgrace.

verses.plain: A slothful man is compared to the filth of a dunghill: every man that takes it up will shake his hand.

tokens.t: A slothful man is compared to the filth of a dunghill: every man that takes it up will shake his hand.

verses.plain: An evilnurtured man is the dishonour of his father that begat him: and a foolish daughter is born to his loss.

tokens.t: An evilnurtured man is the dishonour of his father that begat him: and a
daughter is born to his loss.

verses.plain: A wise daughter shall bring an inheritance to her husband: but she that liveth dishonestly is her father’s heaviness.

tokens.t: A wise daughter shall bring an inheritance to her husband: but she that liveth dishonestly is her father’s heaviness.

verses.plain: She that is bold dishonoureth both her father and her husband, but they both shall despise her.

tokens.t: She that is bold dishonoureth both her father and her husband, but they both shall despise her.

verses.plain: A tale out of season is as musick in mourning: but stripes and correction of wisdom are never out of time.

tokens.t: A tale out of season
musick in mourning: but stripes and correction of wisdom are never out of time.

verses.plain: Whoso teacheth a fool is as one that glueth a potsherd together, and as he that waketh one from a sound sleep.

tokens.t: Whoso teacheth a fool is as one that glueth a potsherd together, and as he that waketh one from a sound sleep.

verses.plain: He that telleth a tale to a fool speaketh to one in a slumber: when he hath told his tale, he will say, What is the matter?

tokens.t: He that telleth a tale to a fool speaketh to one in a slumber: when he hath told his tale, he will say, What is the matter?

verses.plain: If children live honestly, and have wherewithal, they shall cover the baseness of their parents.

tokens.t: If children live honestly, and have wherewithal, they shall cover the baseness of their parents.

verses.plain: But children, being haughty, through disdain and want of nurture do stain the nobility of their kindred.

tokens.t: But children, being haughty, through disdain and want of nurture do stain the nobility of their kindred.

verses.plain: Weep for the dead, for he hath lost the light: and weep for the fool, for he wanteth understanding: make little weeping for the dead, for he is at rest: but the life of the fool is worse than death.

tokens.t: Weep for the dead, for he hath lost the light: and weep for the fool, for he wanteth understanding: make little weeping for the dead, for he is at rest: but the life of the fool is worse than death.

verses.plain: Seven days do men mourn for him that is dead; but for a fool and an ungodly man all the days of his life.

tokens.t: Seven days do men mourn for him that is dead; but for a fool and an ungodly man all the days of his life.

verses.plain: Talk not much with a fool, and go not to him that hath no understanding: beware of him, lest thou have trouble, and thou shalt never be defiled with his fooleries: depart from him, and thou shalt find rest, and never be disquieted with madness.

tokens.t: Talk not much with a fool, and go not to him that hath no understanding: beware of him, lest thou have trouble, and thou shalt never be defiled with his fooleries: depart from him, and thou shalt find rest, and never be disquieted with madness.

verses.plain: What is heavier than lead? and what is the name thereof, but a fool?

tokens.t: What is heavier than lead? and what is the name thereof, but a fool?

verses.plain: Sand, and salt, and a mass of iron, is easier to bear, than a man without understanding.

tokens.t: Sand, and salt, and a mass of iron, is easier to bear, than a man without understanding.

verses.plain: As timber girt and bound together in a building cannot be loosed with shaking: so the heart that is stablished by advised counsel shall fear at no time.

tokens.t: As timber girt and bound together in a building cannot be loosed with shaking: so the heart that is stablished by advised counsel shall fear at no time.

verses.plain: A heart settled upon a thought of understanding is as a fair plaistering on the wall of a gallery.

tokens.t: A heart settled upon a thought of understanding is as a fair plaistering on the wall of a gallery.

verses.plain: Pales set on an high place will never stand against the wind: so a fearful heart in the imagination of a fool cannot stand against any fear.

tokens.t: Pales set on an high place will never stand against the wind: so a fearful heart in the imagination of a fool cannot stand against any fear.

verses.plain: He that pricketh the eye will make tears to fall: and he that pricketh the heart maketh it to shew her knowledge.

tokens.t: He that pricketh the eye will make tears to fall: and he that pricketh the heart maketh it to shew her knowledge.

verses.plain: Whoso casteth a stone at the birds frayeth them away: and he that upbraideth his friend breaketh friendship.

tokens.t: Whoso casteth a stone at the birds frayeth them away: and he that upbraideth his friend breaketh friendship.

verses.plain: Though thou drewest a sword at thy friend, yet despair not: for there may be a returning to favour.

tokens.t: Though thou drewest a sword at thy friend, yet despair not: for there may be a returning

verses.plain: If thou hast opened thy mouth against thy friend, fear not; for there may be a reconciliation: except for upbraiding, or pride, or disclosing of secrets, or a treacherous wound: for for these things every friend will depart.

tokens.t: If thou hast opened thy mouth against thy friend, fear not; for there may be a reconciliation: except for upbraiding, or pride, or disclosing of secrets, or a treacherous wound: for for these things every friend will depart.

verses.plain: Be faithful to thy neighbour in his poverty, that thou mayest rejoice in his prosperity: abide stedfast unto him in the time of his trouble, that thou mayest be heir with him in his heritage: for a mean estate is not always to be contemned: nor the rich that is foolish to be had in admiration.

tokens.t: Be faithful to thy neighbour in his poverty, that thou mayest rejoice in his prosperity: abide stedfast unto him in the time of his trouble, that thou mayest be heir with him in his heritage: for a mean estate is not always to be contemned: nor the rich that is foolish to be had in admiration.

verses.plain: As the vapour and smoke of a furnace goeth before the fire; so reviling before blood.

tokens.t: As the vapour and smoke of a furnace goeth before the fire; so reviling before blood.

verses.plain: I will not be ashamed to defend a friend; neither will I hide myself from him.

tokens.t: I will not be ashamed to defend a friend; neither will I hide myself from him.

verses.plain: And if any evil happen unto me by him, every one that heareth it will beware of him.

tokens.t: And if any evil happen unto me by him, every one that heareth it will beware of him.

verses.plain: Who shall set a watch before my mouth, and a seal of wisdom upon my lips, that I fall not suddenly by them, and that my tongue destroy me not?

tokens.t: Who shall set a watch before my mouth, and a seal of wisdom upon my lips, that I fall not suddenly by them, and that my tongue destroy me not?
